# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function `wrap_string` that fits the specified requirements:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    output = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            output *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        else
            line *= length(line) > 0 ? " $word" : word
        end
    end
    output *= line
    return output
end

# Example
text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language."
println(wrap_string(text, 10))
```

This function takes a string `text` and an optional integer `text_width` (with a default value of 10) representing the maximum width of the text. It will wrap the text so that each line does not exceed the `text_width`, adding a newline character to achieve this. When running the provided example you should see the text wrapped accordingly.
